The incident management process exhibits critical non-compliance, with an overall compliance cost of 140.9, significantly exceeding the defined 'critical' threshold of 2.0. Furthermore, average durations for Detection (6035 min), Activation (12655 min), Awaiting (23530 min), and Resolution (8531 min) critically surpass non-acceptable time thresholds. As a Monitor, I recommend immediate investigation into the root causes of these persistent missing and mismatched activities, particularly in the Activation state, and the severe bottlenecks causing excessive time in core process stages to enforce adherence to the reference model.
